description: The chequer motif achieved by plain bands (here with raised borders), each chequer filled with the comma pattern (cf. Karlgren Number 55, 50.46.10), is common on these flat Hu. The rising blades on the neck are bare. The t'ao-t'ieh mask on the loose ring handles has the volute with triangle as its principal decor feature (on the ring in inlay); on the cheek line there is a granulation pattern. Patina greenish-grey. With copper inlay; Huai style.
text: With its flattened oval form and a brickwork arrangement of rectangular panels decorated with a tight "feather curl" pattern in relief, this wine flask emphasizes the creative approach taken toward surface ornamentation during the late Bronze Age. The bands dividing the cast panels and triangle pattern on the neck are of inlaid copper. The "feather curl" pattern seen here exists in slightly different versions on many other late Zhou bronzes and seems to have persisted from about 600 to 250 BCE.
title: Wine vessel bianhu
